channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Nathanel Young, British man serving in Israeli military, killed in Hamas attack
item.description: Nathanel Young was serving with the Israeli military when he was killed on the Gaza border.

item.title: Afghanistan earthquake: Race to rescue victims in Herat Province
item.description: More than 1,000 are feared dead after the 6.3-magnitude quake hit remote villages in western Afghanistan.

item.title: Metro Bank strikes deal to shore up balance sheet
item.description: A £325m cash injection, as well as refinancing £600m of debt, will enable it to keep expanding, it says.

item.title: Labour's Rachel Reeves to set out plan to recover Covid fraud billions
item.description: An anti-corruption commissioner would target £7.2bn lost to fraud, the shadow chancellor will say.

item.title: Doctors up for longer hours for more overtime pay, says Keir Starmer
item.description: The Labour leaders says NHS staff in England will volunteer for longer hours to cut waiting lists.

item.title: Wilko: End of an era as shops shut for good
item.description: Workers and shoppers tell us what they'll miss about the brand as the final stores close.

item.title: Back of Cockermouth's Old Courthouse collapses into river
item.description: The Grade II-listed Old Courthouse in Cockermouth was badly damaged early on Sunday.

item.title: Johnson's ex-wife is Labour's new sex harassment adviser
item.description: Marina Wheeler KC is looking at how to strengthen the law to protect women who are bullied at work.

item.title: Destroyed cars line road near Israel festival in chilling video
item.description: The remains of cars can be seen after militants attacked people attending an outdoor party.

item.title: Two Israeli tourists and local guide shot dead in Egypt, Israel says
item.description: Another Israeli was wounded in the attack in the city of Alexandria, Israel's foreign ministry says.

item.title: Kiptum shatters marathon record and moves within reach of two-hour mark
item.description: Kenyan Kelvin Kiptum shatters the men's marathon world record in Chicago as he beats compatriot Eliud Kipchoge's previous mark by more than 30 seconds.

item.title: Don't tilt too far towards unions, warns Peter Mandelson
item.description: The key architect of New Labour says the party needs to ensure it can attract private investment.

item.title: Arsenal 1-0 Manchester City: Gabriel Martinelli scores dramatic late winner
item.description: Gabriel Martinelli hits the late winner as Arsenal earn a statement victory over defending Premier League champions Manchester City at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: 'Like a horror movie' - Israel music festival-goers fled in hail of bullets
item.description: Festival-goers describe mass panic as they fled and hid in bushes as a trance music party came under attack.

item.title: Shani Louk: Mother pleads for help as daughter goes missing at festival
item.description: Shani Louk's family believe she was taken away by Hamas militants in the back of a pick-up truck.

item.title: Gaza hospital deluged as Israel retaliation kills and wounds hundreds
item.description: A BBC reporter in Gaza says there is almost no power and hospitals are overrun after Israeli air strikes.

item.title: How Hamas staged lightning assault no one thought possible
item.description: Palestinian militants launched the type of widespread surprise attack that no one expected.

item.title: Watch: Fierce gun battle on Israeli highway
item.description: Motorists duck for cover as multiple shots are fired during a gun battle on Route 4, between Ashdod and the Gaza border.

item.title: What is Hamas, what is happening in Israel and Gaza Strip, and other questions
item.description: We explain the background to the militant group, the scale of their attack on Israel and what could happen next.

item.title: Fear for fate of hostages seized by Hamas
item.description: A "significant number" of Israelis are being held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip, the Israeli military says.

item.title: Israel blindsided, says Jeremy Bowen
item.description: Risk of flare-up between Palestinian militants and Israel has been deepening for months, writes Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: Watch: A day of violence and fear
item.description: Watch the footage of unprecedented scenes in Israel and Gaza, verified and explained by the BBC.

item.title: What comes next for Israel?
item.description: Tensions had recently risen in Gaza - but this attack was unexpected on a Jewish holiday.

item.title: Israel tries to clear seized areas as PM warns of 'long war'
item.description: Troops try to clear gunmen from several areas, as the Israeli death toll reportedly passes 600.

item.title: People hide in homes as Palestinian militants enter from Gaza
item.description: People in towns near the Gaza Strip are phoning news stations saying they are trapped in their homes.

item.title: The Papers: 'US sends warships' and 'pawns of terrorists'
item.description: Monday's papers continue their coverage on Israel-Palestine in the aftermath of deadly attacks.

item.title: Antigua and Barbuda's youth orchestra plays to inspire
item.description: Accessibility for all is at the core of the ethos for Antigua and Barbuda's youth orchestra.

item.title: 'I've suffered from bedbugs for two years'
item.description: Despite a recent spike in interest in bedbugs, their interaction with humans is nothing new.

item.title: Biden cannot escape Trump's shadow in border crisis
item.description: To the anger of his supporters, the US president is ramping up deportation and expanding the wall.

item.title: Nevada lithium mine leads to 'green colonialism' accusations
item.description: The rush to mine lithium for car batteries is dividing environmental and native American communities.

item.title: Do you want to know a secret? Teenagers tell all for new stage show
item.description: Hundreds of people allow their secrets - from the harmless to the serious - to be aired in public.

item.title: Polish elections: When are they and why is Europe watching closely?
item.description: Poland's upcoming elections have been called the most important since the fall of communism in 1989.

item.title: The Papers: 'Human shield horror' and Israel's '9/11 moment'
item.description: Sunday's headlines focus on Israel suffering its biggest attack in years at the hands of Palestinian militants.

item.title: Chris Mason: Starmer grapples with how to keep Labour ahead
item.description: The Labour leader won't be short of advice in Liverpool - but how does he convert a commanding poll lead into a general election victory?

item.title: Significant quantity of drugs found off Dorset coast
item.description: Packages and holdalls believed to contain cocaine are washing up on England's south coast.

item.title: Sycamore Gap tree: Site plans are complicated, says MP
item.description: Discussions over the site are ongoing but the issue is not simple, Hexham MP Guy Opperman says.

item.title: Aberdeenshire amateur side St Machar Thistle AFC 'owning' 51-0 cup defeat
item.description: St Machar Thistle AFC started with just eight players and lost 51-0 to AC Mill Inn Academy in the first round of the Scottish Amateur Cup.

item.title: Flooding risk remains high in parts of Scotland despite rain easing
item.description: River levels are continuing to rise and the ground is saturated, increasing the risk of flooding.

item.title: Calls for more action on Brightlingsea's mystery stench
item.description: The smell has been blighting the seaside town of Brightlingsea for some time.

item.title: Amy Dowden makes Strictly Come Dancing return after cancer diagnosis
item.description: The dancer gave an update on her chemotherapy treatment, saying she is "doing really well".

item.title: Wayne Rooney leaves DC United after failing to reach MLS play-offs
item.description: Wayne Rooney leaves his role as coach of MLS side DC United by mutual consent after they fail to make the play-offs.

item.title: An all girls cricket team in India breaks with tradition
item.description: A coach in a small village in Punjab state is training young girls to give them shot at a sports career.

item.title: Terence Davies: Screenwriter and film director dies aged 77
item.description: Davies, known for films such as Benediction and A Quiet Passion, died after a short illness, his manager confirms.

item.title: Lin and Megan Russell's killer granted review of convictions
item.description: Michael Stone's case is to be looked at again after Levi Bellfield reportedly confessed to the murders.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: Why Wales and Brittany anthems sound the same
item.description: Wales' Celtic language speaking cousins in France copied the tune of the Welsh national anthem.

item.title: Cap for pioneer black footballer handed to the club he captained
item.description: The family of legendary black footballer Jack Leslie present his FA cap to Plymouth Argyle.

item.title: Arsenal 1-0 Manchester City: A significant win in Mikel Arteta's career
item.description: Arsenal's win against Manchester City could be one of the most significant moments in Mikel Arteta's career if it has the galvanising impact it should have, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Fiji 23-24 Portugal: England to face Fiji in Rugby World Cup quarter-final
item.description: Portugal cause a shock in Toulouse, but a losing bonus point is enough to send Fiji into a Rugby World Cup quarter-final against England.

item.title: Qatar Grand Prix: Max Verstappen wins as Lewis Hamilton and George Russell collide
item.description: Mercedes drivers Lewis Hamilton and George Russell collided at the start before Max Verstappen went on to dominate the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How Arsenal stopped Manchester City playing
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Danny Murphy and Alan Shearer analyse how Arsenal prevented Manchester City from playing their usual game, and claimed a 1-0 win.

item.title: Manchester City v Chelsea: The 'ridiculous' red card which affected big match
item.description: The 26 seconds that Alex Greenwood used up before taking a free-kick for Manchester City proved more costly than expected in their 1-1 draw with Chelsea.

item.title: Bukayo Saka: Arsenal forward not available for England fixtures, says boss Mikel Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says forward Bukayo Saka will not join up with England for October's international fixtures.

item.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Raheem Sterling, Mohamed Salah and Scott McTominay
item.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his eighth Premier League Team of the Week?
